Use Mental Pictures to Get a Better Job
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 60 | posizione 914-917 | Aggiunto in data lunedì 5 settembre 2016 19:42:10

you have an important interview coming up, such as making an application for a job, his advice was: plan for the interview in advance. Go over in your mind, all the various questions that you are likely to be asked. Think about the answers you are going to
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 60 | posizione 917-921 | Aggiunto in data lunedì 5 settembre 2016 19:42:20

give. Then "rehearse" the interview in your mind. Even if none of the questions you have rehearsed come up, the rehearsal practice will still work wonders. It gives you confidence. And even though real life has not set lines to be recited like a stage play, rehearsal practice will help you to ad lib and react spontaneously to whatever situa- tion you find yourself in, because you have practiced reacting spontaneously.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 61 | posizione 921-923 | Aggiunto in data lunedì 5 settembre 2016 19:42:29

"Don't be a ham actor," Dr. Marston would say, ex- plaining that we are always acting out some role in life. Why not select the right role, the role of a successful per- son—and rehearse it?
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 61 | posizione 924-928 | Aggiunto in data lunedì 5 settembre 2016 19:43:07

"Frequently the next step in your career cannot be taken without first gaining some experience in the work you will be called upon to perform. Bluff may open the door to a job you know nothing about but in nine cases out of ten it won't keep you from being fired when your inexperience becomes evident. There's only one way I know to project your practical knowledge beyond your present occupation and that is rehearsal planning."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 63 | posizione 962-962 | Aggiunto in data lunedì 5 settembre 2016 19:43:55

The Real Secret of Mental Picturing
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 65 | posizione 983-986 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:35:05

As Alex Morrison says, you must first clearly see a thing in your mind before you can do it. When you do see a thing clearly in your mind, your creative "success mechanism" within you takes over and does the job much bet- ter than you could do it by conscious effort, or "will power."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 65 | posizione 986-989 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:35:31

Instead of trying hard by conscious effort to do the thing by iron-jawed will power, and all the while worry- ing and picturing to yourself all the things that are likely to go wrong, you simply relax the strain, stop trying to "do it" by strain and effort, picture to yourself the target you really want to hit, and "let" your creative success mechanism take over. Thus, mental-picturing the
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 65 | posizione 989-990 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:35:39

desired end result, literally forces you to use "positive thinking."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 65 | posizione 992-993 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:36:25

Finding Your Best Self
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 65 | posizione 993-995 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:36:37

This same creative mechanism within you can help you achieve your best possible "self" if you will form a picture in your imagination of the self you wanted to be and "see yourself" in the new role. This is a necessary condition to personality transformation, regardless of the method of therapy used.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 67 | posizione 1020-1020 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:38:43

Know the Truth About Yourself
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 67 | posizione 1020-1023 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:39:12

The aim of self-image psychology is not to create a ficti- tious self which is all-powerful, arrogant, egoistic, all- important. Such an image is as inappropriate and unrealistic as the inferior image of self. Our aim is to find the "real self," and to bring our mental images of
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 67 | posizione 1023-1024 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:39:21

ourselves more in line with "the objects they represent." However, it is common knowledge among psychologists that most of us under-rate ourselves; short change ourselves, and sell ourselves short.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 69 | posizione 1055-1055 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:42:24

PRACTICE EXERCISE:
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 69 | posizione 1055-1059 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:42:37

"Hold a picture of yourself long and steadily enough in your mind's eye and you will be drawn toward it," said Dr. Harry Emerson Fosdick. "Picture yourself vividly as defeated and that alone will make victory impossible. Picture yourself vividly as winning and that alone will con- tribute immeasurably to success. Great living starts with a picture, held in your imagination, of what you would like to do or be."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1059-1061 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:42:47

Your present self-image was built upon your own imagination pictures of yourself in the past which grew out of interpretations and evaluations which you placed upon experience.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1061-1061 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:42:51

Now you are to use the same method
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1061-1062 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:42:56

to build an adequate self-image that you previously used to build an inadequate one.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1062-1068 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:43:17

Set aside a period of 30 minutes each day where you can be alone and undisturbed. Relax and make yourself as comfortable as possible. Now close your eyes and exer- cise your imagination. Many people find they get better results if they imagine themselves sitting before a large motion picture screen— and imagine that they are seeing a motion picture of them- selves. The important thing is to make these pictures as vivid and as detailed as possible. You want your mental pictures to approximate actual experience as much as possible.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1068-1068 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:43:25

The way to do this is pay attention to small
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1068-1072 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:43:35

details, sights, sounds, objects, in your imagined environment. One of my patients was using this exercise to overcome her fear of the dentist. She was unsuccessful, until she began to notice small details in her imagined picture—the smell of the antiseptic in the office, the feel of the leather on the chair arms, the sight of the dentist's well-manicured nails as his hands approached her mouth, etc. Details of the
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 70 | posizione 1072-1074 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:43:39

imagined environment are all-important in this exercise, because for all practical purposes, you are creating a practice experience. And if the imagination is vivid enough and detailed enough, your imagination practice is equivalent to an actual experience, insofar as your nervous
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 71 | posizione 1075-1081 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:44:04

The next important thing to remember is that during this 30 minutes you see yourself acting and reacting appro- priately, successfully, ideally. It doesn't matter how you acted yesterday. You do not need to try to have faith you will act in the ideal way tomorrow. Your nervous system will take care of that in time—if you continue to practice. See yourself acting, feeling, "being," as you want to be. Do not say to yourself, "I am going to act this way to- morrow." Just say to yourself—"I am going to imagine myself acting in this way now—for 30 minutes—today."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 71 | posizione 1081-1087 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:44:10

Imagine how you would feel if you were already the sort of personality you want to be. If you have been shy and timid, see yourself moving among people with ease and poise—and feeling good because of it. If you have been fearful and anxious in certain situations—see yourself acting calmly and deliberately, acting with confidence and courage—and feeling expansive and confident because you are. This exercise builds new "memories" or stored data into your mid-brain and central nervous system. It builds a new image of self. After practicing it for a time, you will be surprised to find yourself "acting differently," more or less automatically and spontaneously—"without trying."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 71 | posizione 1087-1091 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:44:28

This is as it should be. You do not need to "take thought" or "try" or make an effort now in order to feel ineffective and act inadequately. Your present inadequate feeling and doing is automatic and spontaneous, because of the memories, real and imagined, you have built into your automatic mechanism. You will find it will work just as automatically upon positive thoughts and experiences as upon negative ones.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 72 | posizione 1095-1096 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:44:42

CHAPTER FOUR Dehypnotize Yourself From False Beliefs
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 74 | posizione 1122-1129 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:46:34

Now the point I want to make is this: Adler had been hypnotized by a false belief about himself. Not figuratively, but literally and actually hypnotized. Remember that we said in the last chapter that the power of hypnosis is the power of belief. Let me repeat here Dr. Barber's explanation of the "power" of hypnosis: "We found that hypnotic subjects are able to do surprising things only when convinced that the hypnotist's words are true statements. . . . When the hypnotist has guided the subject to the point where he is convinced that the hypnotist's words are true statements, the subject then behaves differently because he thinks and believes differently."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 81 | posizione 1241-1246 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:53:25

Within you, whoever you may be, regardless of how big a failure you may think yourself to be, is the ability and the power to do whatever you need to do to be happy and successful. Within you right now is the power to do things you never dreamed possible. This power becomes available to you just as soon as you can change your be- liefs. Just as quickly as you can dehypnotize yourself from the ideas of "I can't," "I'm not worthy," "I don't deserve it" and other self-limiting ideas.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 82 | posizione 1246-1246 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:53:30

You Can Cure Your Inferiority Complex
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 82 | posizione 1257-1261 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:54:20

Feelings of inferiority originate not so much from "facts" or experiences, but our conclusions regarding facts, and our evaluation of experiences. For example, the fact is that I am an inferior weight-lifter and an inferior dancer. This does not, however, make me an "inferior person." Paul Anderson's and Arthur Murray's inability to perform surgery makes them "inferior surgeons," but not "inferior persons." It all depends upon "what" and "whose" norms we measure ourselves by.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 83 | posizione 1261-1266 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:55:05

It is not knowledge of actual inferiority in skill or knowledge which gives us an inferiority complex and interferes with our living. It is the feeling of inferiority that does this. And this feeling of inferiority comes about for just one reason: We judge ourselves, and measure ourselves, not against our own "norm" or "par" but against some other individual's "norm." When we do this, we always, without exception, come out second best. But because we think, and believe and assume that we should measure up to some other person's "norm,"
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 83 | posizione 1270-1275 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:55:28

All this comes about because we have allowed our- selves to be hypnotized by the entirely erroneous idea that "I should be like so-and-so" or "I should be like everybody else." The fallacy of the second idea can be readily seen through, if analyzed, for in truth there are no fixed • standards common to "everybody else." "Everybody else" is composed of individuals, no two of whom are alike. The person with an inferiority complex invariably com- pounds the error by striving for superiority. His feelings spring from the false premise that he is inferior.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 84 | posizione 1276-1282 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:56:28

If he feels bad because he is inferior, the cure is to make himself as good as everybody else, and the way to feel really good is to make himself supe- rior. This striving for superiority gets him into more trouble, causes more frustration, and sometimes brings about a neurosis where none existed before. He becomes more miserable than ever, and "the harder he tries," the more miserable he becomes. Inferiority and Superiority are reverse sides of the same coin. The cure lies in realizing that the coin itself is spurious.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 84 | posizione 1282-1286 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:56:55

The truth about you is this: You are not "inferior." You are not "superior." You are simply "You." "You" as a personality are not in competition with any other personality simply because there is not another person on the face of the earth like you, or in your particular class. You are an individual. You are unique. You are not "like" any other person and can never become "like" any other person. You are not "supposed" to be like any
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 84 | posizione 1287-1287 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:56:59

other person and no other person is "supposed" to be like you.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 85 | posizione 1302-1304 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:58:39

Stop measuring yourself against "their" standards. You are not "them" and can never measure up. Neither can "they" measure up to yours—nor should they. Once you see this simple, rather self-evident truth, accept it and believe it, your inferior feelings will vanish.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1304-1306 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:58:59

Dr. Norton L. Williams, psychiatrist, addressing a medi- cal convention, said recently that modern man's anxiety and insecurity stemmed from a lack of "self-realization,"
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1306-1308 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:59:03

and that inner security can only be found "in finding in oneself an individuality, uniqueness and distinctiveness that is akin to the idea of being created in the image of
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1308-1309 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:59:09

God." He also said that self-realization is gained by "a simple belief in one's own uniqueness as a human being,
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1309-1310 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 07:59:18

sense of deep and wide awareness of all people and all things and a feeling of constructive influencing of others through one's own personality."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1310-1311 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:02:29

HOW TO USE RELAXATION TO DEHYPNOTIZE YOURSELF
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1311-1312 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:02:35

Physical relaxation plays a key role in the dehypno- tization process.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1312-1313 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:03:01

Our currently held beliefs, whether good or bad, true or false, were formed without effort, with no sense of strain, and without the exercise of "will power."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1314-1315 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:03:08

It follows that we must employ the same process in forming new beliefs, or new habits, that is, in a relaxed condition.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1316-1317 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:04:49

It has been amply demonstrated that attempting to use effort or will power to change beliefs or to cure bad habits has an adverse, rather than a beneficial effect.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 86 | posizione 1317-1321 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:05:21

Emile Coué, the little French pharmacist who astonished the world around 1920 with the results he obtained with "the power of suggestion," insisted that effort was the one big reason most people failed to utilize their inner powers. "Your suggestions (ideal goals) must be made without effort if they are to be effective," he said. Another famous Coué saying was his "Law of Reversed Effort": "When the will and the imagination are in conflict, the
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 87 | posizione 1321-1321 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:05:26

imagination invariably wins the day."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 87 | posizione 1321-1325 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:06:03

The late Dr. Knight Dunlap made a lifelong study of habits and learning processes and perhaps performed more experiments along this line than any other psycholo- gist. His methods succeeded in curing such habits as nail- biting, thumb-sucking, facial tics, and more serious habits where other methods had failed. The very heart of his
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 87 | posizione 1325-1326 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:06:12

system was his finding that effort was the one big deter- rent to either breaking a bad habit, or learning a new
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 87 | posizione 1326-1331 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:06:26

one. Making an effort to refrain from the habit, actually re- inforced the habit, he found. His experiments proved that the best way to break a habit is to form a clear mental image of the desired end result, and to practice without effort toward reaching that goal. Dunlap found that either "positive practice" (refraining from the habit) or "negative practice" (performing the habit consciously and voluntarily), would have beneficial effect provided the desired end result was kept constantly in mind.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1337-1341 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:08:15

In many cases, the mere relaxation of effort, or too much conscious straining, is in itself enough to eradicate the negative behavior pattern. Dr. James S. Greene, found- er of the National Hospital for Speech Disorders, New York City, had a motto: "When they can relax, they can talk." Dr. Matthew N. Chappell has pointed out that often the effort or "will power" used to fight against or resist worry, is the very thing that perpetuates worry
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1341-1341 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:08:31

and keeps it going.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1342-1344 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:09:21

Physical relaxation, when practiced daily, brings about an accompanying "mental relaxation," and a "relaxed attitude" which enables us to better consciously control our automatic mechanism. Physical relaxation also, in itself, has a powerful influence in "dehypnotizing" us from negative attitudes and reaction patterns.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1344-1345 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:09:35

DEHYPNOTIZE YOURSELF 6l How to Use Mental Pictures to Relax
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1345-1346 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:09:41

PRACTICE EXERCISE: (To be practiced for at least 30 minutes daily)
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1346-1347 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:10:03

Seat yourself comfortably in an easy chair or lie down on your back. Consciously "let go" the various muscle groups as much as possible without making too much
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 88 | posizione 1347-1354 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:10:10

of an effort of it. Just consciously pay attention to the various parts of your body and let go a little. You will find that you can always voluntarily relax to a certain degree. You can stop frowning and let your forehead relax. You can ease up a little on the tension in your jaws. You can let your hands, your arms, your shoulders, legs, become a little more relaxed than they are. Spend about five minutes on this and then stop paying any attention to your muscles. This is as far as you are going to try to go by conscious control. From here on you will relax more and more by using your creative mechanism to automatically bring
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 89 | posizione 1354-1355 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:10:56

about a relaxed condition. In short, you are going to use "goal pictures," held in imagination and let your automatic mechanism realize those goals for you.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 89 | posizione 1355-1360 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:02

Mental Picture No. 1 In your mind's eye see yourself lying stretched out upon the bed. Form a picture of your legs as they would look if made of concrete. See yourself lying there with two very heavy concrete legs. See these very heavy concrete legs sulking far down into the mattress from their sheer weight. Now picture your arms and hands as made of concrete. They also are very heavy and are sinking down into the bed and exerting tremendous pressure against the
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 89 | posizione 1360-1363 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:31

bed. In your mind's eye see a friend come into the room and attempt to lift your heavy concrete legs. He takes hold of your feet and attempts to lift them. But they are 62 PSYCHO-CYBERNETICS too heavy for him. He cannot do it Repeat with arms, neck, etc.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 89 | posizione 1363-1367 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:39

Mental Picture No. 2 Your body is a big marionette doll. Your hands are tied loosely to your wrists by strings. Your forearm is con- nected loosely by a string to your upper arm. Your upper arm is connected very loosely by a string to your shoul- der. Your feet, calves, thighs, are also connected together
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 90 | posizione 1367-1371 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:44

with a single string. Your neck consists of one very limp string. The strings which control your jaw and hold your lips together have slackened and stretched to such an ex- tent that your chin has dropped down loosely against your chest. All the various strings which connect the var- ious parts of your body are loose and limp and your body is just sprawled loosely across the bed.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 90 | posizione 1371-1373 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:48

Mental Picture No. 3 Your body consists of a series of inflated rubber bal- loons. Two valves open in your feet, and the air begins to escape from your legs. Your legs begin to collapse and
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 90 | posizione 1373-1375 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:52

continue until they consist only of deflated rubber tubes, lying flat against the bed. Next a valve is opened in your chest and as the air begins to escape, your entire trunk begins to collapse limply against the bed. Continue with arms, head, and neck.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 90 | posizione 1376-1379 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:11:57

Mental Picture No. 4 Many people will find this the most relaxing of all. Just go back in memory to some relaxing and pleasant scene from your past. There is always some time in everyone's life when he felt relaxed, at ease, and at peace with the world. Pick out your own relaxing picture from your past
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 90 | posizione 1379-1380 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:12:02

and call up detailed memory images. Yours may be a peaceful scene at a mountain lake where you went fishing.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 91 | posizione 1381-1385 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:12:14

so, pay particular attention to the little incidental things in the environment. Remember the quiet ripples on the water. What sounds were present? Did you hear the quiet rustling of the leaves? Maybe you remember sitting per- fectly relaxed, and somewhat drowsy before an open fire- place long ago. Did the logs crackle and spark? What other sights and sounds were present? Maybe you choose to remember relaxing in the sun on a beach. How did
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 91 | posizione 1385-1388 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:12:21

the sand feel against your body? Could you feel the warm re- laxing sun, touching your body, almost as a physical thing? Was there a breeze blowing? Were there gulls on the beach? The more of these incidental details you can remember and picture to yourself, the more successful you will be.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 91 | posizione 1388-1390 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:12:32

Daily practice will bring these mental pictures, or memories, clearer and clearer. The effect of learning will also be cumulative. Practice will strengthen the tie-in be- tween mental image and physical sensation. You will
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 91 | posizione 1390-1391 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:12:45

come more and more proficient in relaxation, and this in itself will be "remembered" in future practice sessions.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 91 | posizione 1394-1395 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:12:50

CHAPTER FIVE How to Utilize The Power of Rational Thinking
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 93 | posizione 1414-1420 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:15:46

Regardless of the omissions and commissions of the past," he said, "a person has to start in the present to acquire some maturity so that the future may be better than the past. The present and the future depend on learning new habits and new ways of looking at old problems. There simply isn't any future in digging continually into the past. . . the underlying emotional problem has the, same common denominator in every patient. This common denominator is that the patient has forgotten how, or probably never learned how, to control his present thinking to produce enjoyment." (John A. Schindler, How To Live 365 Days a Year, Englewood Cliffs, N.J., Prentice-Hall, Inc.) Let Sleeping Dogs Lie
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 93 | posizione 1420-1421 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:15:53

The fact that there are "buried" in the unconscious, memories of past failures, unpleasant and painful experiences, does not mean that these must be "dug
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 93 | posizione 1421-1422 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:16:00

out," exposed or examined, in order to effect personality changes.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 94 | posizione 1435-1440 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:19:07

Our errors, mistakes, failures, and sometimes even our humiliations, were necessary steps in the learning process. However, they were meant to be means to an end—and not an end in themselves. When they have served their purpose, they should be forgotten. If we consciously dwell upon the error, or consciously feel guilty about the error, and keep berating ourselves because of it, then—unwit- tingly—the error or failure itself becomes the "goal" which is consciously held in imagination and memory.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 94 | posizione 1440-1440 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:19:11

The un-happiest of mortals is that man who insists upon reliving
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 94 | posizione 1441-1442 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:19:15

the past, over and over in imagination—continually criti- cising himself for past mistakes—continually condemning himself for past sins.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 95 | posizione 1456-1458 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:21:25

Continually criticising yourself for past mistakes and errors does not help matters, but on the other hand tends to perpetuate the very behavior you would change.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 96 | posizione 1458-1459 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:21:32

Memories of past failures can adversely affect present performance, if we dwell upon them and foolishly conclude —"I failed yesterday—therefore it follows that I will fail
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 96 | posizione 1459-1464 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:21:53

again today." However, this does not "prove" that unconscious reaction patterns have any power in themselves to repeat and perpetuate themselves, or that all buried memories of failure must be "eradicated" before behavior can be changed. If we are victimized, it is by our conscious, thinking mind and not by the "unconscious." For it is with the thinking part of our personality that we draw conclusions, and select the "goal images" that we shall concentrate upon. The minute that we change our minds, and stop giving power to the past, the past with its mis- takes loses power over us.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 96 | posizione 1464-1464 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:21:59

Ignore Past Failures and Forge Ahead

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 96 | posizione 1465-1466 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 17:22:27

Here again, hypnosis furnishes convincing proof. When a shy, timid wallflower is told in hypnosis, and believes or "thinks" that he is a bold, self-confident orator, his reaction patterns are changed instantly.

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 96 | posizione 1467-1469 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:10:07

His attention is given over com- pletely to the positive desired goal—and no thought or consideration whatsoever is given to past failures.

Bertrand Russell's Method
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 98 | posizione 1498-1498 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:13:06

your
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 98 | posizione 1498-1502 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:13:17

feeling of remorse, and convince yourself in detail of their absurdity. Let your conscious beliefs be so vivid and emphatic that they make an impression upon your uncon- scious strong enough to cope with the impressions made by your nurse or your mother when you were an infant. Do not be content with an alteration between moments of rationality and moments of irrationality.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 98 | posizione 1502-1505 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:13:33

Look into the irrationality closely with a determination not to respect it and not to let it dominate you. When it thrusts foolish thoughts or feelings into your consciousness, pull them up by the roots, examine them, and reject them. Do not allow yourself to remain a vacillating creature, swayed half
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 99 | posizione 1505-1508 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:13:47

by reason and half by infantile folly... . "But if the rebellion is to be successful in bringing individual happiness and in enabling a man to live consistently by one standard, not to vacillate between two, it is neces- sary that he should think and feel deeply about what his reason tells him.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 99 | posizione 1516-1517 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:14:51

Ideas Are Changed, Not by "Will," But by Other Ideas
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 100 | posizione 1519-1523 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:15:44

Lecky's method consisted of getting the subject to "see" that some negative concept of his was inconsistent with some other deeply held belief. Lecky believed that it was inherent in the very nature of "mind" itself, that all ideas and concepts which make up the total content of "personality" must seem to be consistent with each other. If the inconsistency of a given idea is consciously recog- nized, it must be rejected.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 100 | posizione 1532-1536 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:16:38

Lecky found that there were two powerful "levers" for changing beliefs and concepts. There are "standard" convictions which are strongly held by nearly everyone. These are (1) the feeling or belief that one is capable of doing his share, holding up his end of the log, exerting a certain amount of independence and (2) the belief that there is "something" inside you which should not be allowed to suffer indignities.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 101 | posizione 1536-1536 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:16:46

Examine and Re-evaluate Your Beliefs
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 101 | posizione 1544-1546 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:29:22

Remember that both behavior and feeling spring from belief. To root out the belief which is responsible for your feeling and behavior—ask yourself, "why?" Is there some task which you would like to do, some channel in which
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 101 | posizione 1546-1551 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:29:26

you would like to express yourself, but you hang back feeling that "I can't"? Ask yourself "WHY?" "Why do I believe that I can't?" Then ask yourself—"Is this belief based upon an actual fact-—or upon an assumption—or a false conclusion?" Then ask yourself the questions: 1. Is there any rational reason for such a belief? 2. Could it be that I am mistaken in this belief? 3. Would I come to the same conclusion about some
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 102 | posizione 1551-1556 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:29:38

other person in a similar situation? 4. Why should I continue to act and feel as if this were true if there is no good reason to believe it? Don't just pass these questions by casually. Wrestle with them. Think hard on them. Get emotional about them. Can you see that you have cheated yourself and sold your- self short—not because of a "fact"—but only because of some stupid belief? If so, try to arouse some indignation, or even anger. Indignation and anger can sometimes act as liberators from false ideas.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 103 | posizione 1578-1581 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:31:19

Picture to yourself what you would like to be and have, and assume for the moment that such things might be pos- sible. Arouse a deep desire for these things. Become en- thusiastic about them. Dwell upon them—and keep going over them in your mind. Your present negative beliefs were formed by thought plus feelings. Generate enough emotion, or deep feeling, and your new thoughts and
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 104 | posizione 1582-1584 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:31:42

ideas will cancel them out. If you will analyze this you will see that you are using a process you have often used before—worry! The only dif- ference is you change your goals from negative to positive.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 104 | posizione 1585-1587 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:32:02

You use no effort or will power. But you keep dwelling upon the "end result." You keep thinking about it—dwelling upon it—picturing it to yourself as a "possibility." You play with the idea that it "might happen."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 104 | posizione 1588-1594 | Aggiunto in data martedì 6 settembre 2016 21:32:13

This constant repetition, and thinking in terms of "possibilities," makes the end result appear more and more "real" to you. After a time, appropriate emotions are automatically generated—fear, anxiety, discouragement-all these are appropriate to the undesirable end result you are worrying about. Now change the "goal picture"—and you can as easily generate "good emotions." Constantly picturing to yourself, and dwelling upon a desirable end result will also make the possibility seem more real—and again appropriate emotions of enthusiasm, cheerfulness, encouragement, and happiness will automatically be generated. "In forming 'good' emotional habits, and in breaking 'bad' ones," said Dr. Knight Dunlap, "we have to deal primarily with thought and thought habits.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 104 | posizione 1595-1595 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:12:38

What Rational Thought Can and Cannot Do
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 105 | posizione 1595-1597 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:12:55

Remember that your automatic mechanism can as easily function as a "Failure Mechansim" as a "Success Mechanism," depending upon the data you give it to process, and the goals you set for it. It is basically a goal-striving mechanism.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 105 | posizione 1601-1603 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:13:47

It is very important that the automatic mechanism be given true facts concerning the environment. This is the job of conscious rational thought: to know the truth, to form correct evaluations, estimations, opinions.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 106 | posizione 1611-1611 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:14:24

You Never Know Until You Try
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 106 | posizione 1617-1621 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:15:06

It is the job of the conscious rational mind to form log- ical and correct conclusions. "I failed once in the past, so I will probably fail in the future," is neither logical nor rational. To conclude "I can't" in advance, without trying, and in the absence of any evidence to the contrary, is not rational. We should be more like the man who was asked if he could play the piano. "I don't know," he said.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 106 | posizione 1622-1622 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:15:22

Decide What You Want— Not What You Don't Want
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 106 | posizione 1622-1625 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:15:39

is the job of conscious rational thought to decide what you want, select the goals you wish to achieve—and concentrate upon these rather than upon what you do not want. To spend time and effort concentrating upon what you do not want is not rational.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 107 | posizione 1628-1629 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:15:52

Keep Your Eye on the Ball
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 108 | posizione 1641-1644 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:17:40

short, conscious rational thought selects the goal, gathers information, concludes, evaluates, estimates and starts the wheels in motion. It is not, however, responsible for results. We must learn to do our work, act upon the best assumptions available, and leave results to take care of themselves.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1677-1678 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:31:28

and care about the outcome. Unclamp, in a word, your intellectual and practical machinery, and let it run free; and

Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1679-1680 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:31:43

the service it will do you will be twice as good."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1680-1680 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:31:48

Victory by Surrender
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1684-1691 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:32:33

"Under these circum- stances," said James, "the way to success, as vouched for by innumerable authentic personal narrations, is by . . . surrender . . . passivity, not activity—relaxation, not in- tentness, should be now the rule. Give up the feeling of responsibility, let go your hold, resign the care of your destiny to higher powers, be genuinely indifferent as to what becomes of it all. . . . It is but giving your private convulsive self a rest, and finding that a greater Self is there. The results, slow or sudden, or great or small, of the combined optimism and expectancy, the regenerative phenomena which ensue on the abandonment of effort, remain firm facts of human nature."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 111 | posizione 1692-1692 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:32:41

The Secret of Creative Thinking and Creative Doing
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 111 | posizione 1698-1704 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:33:53

All the evidence points to the conclusion that in order to receive an "inspiration" or a "hunch," the person must first of all be intensely interested in solving a particular problem, or securing a particular answer. He must think about it consciously, gather all the information he can on the subject, consider all the possible courses of action. And above all, he must have a burning desire to solve the problem. But, after he has defined the problem, sees in his imagination the desired end result, secured all the information and facts that he can, then additional struggling, fretting and worrying over it do not help,
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 112 | posizione 1704-1705 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:33:57

but seem to hinder the solution.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 113 | posizione 1720-1724 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:36:19

Bertrand Russell said, "I have found, for example, that, if I have to write upon some rather difficult topic, the best plan is to think about it with very great intensity—. the greatest intensity of which I am capable—for a few hours or days, and at the end of that time give orders, so to speak, that the work is to proceed underground. After some months I return consciously to the topic and find
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 113 | posizione 1724-1727 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:36:25

that the work has been done. Before I had discovered this technique, I used to spend the intervening months worrying because I was making no progress; I arrived at the solution none the sooner for this worry, and the in- tervening months were wasted, whereas now I can devote them to other pursuits."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 113 | posizione 1728-1728 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:36:33

FIVE RULES FOR FREEING YOUR CREATIVE MACHINERY
==========

1. "Do your worrying before you place your bet, not after

the wheel starts turning."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 117 | posizione 1789-1789 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:41:25

Consider the risk before the wheel starts
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 117 | posizione 1789-1791 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:41:43

turning.' I used to worry the night before I had to make a speech at a board meeting. Then I said to myself, 'I'm either go- ing to make the speech or I'm not. If the decision is to make it, then there's no need in considering not making it
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 117 | posizione 1792-1794 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:41:52

—or trying to mentally run away from it.' I have dis- covered that much nervousness and anxiety is caused by mentally trying to escape or run away from something that you have decided to go through with physically.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 118 | posizione 1801-1801 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:42:53

Form the habit of consciously responding to the present moment.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 118 | posizione 1801-1802 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:42:59

Consciously practice the habit of "taking no anxious thought for tomorrow," by giving all your attention to the present moment.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 118 | posizione 1801-1802 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:43:18

2. Form the habit of consciously responding to the present moment. Consciously practice the habit of "taking no anxious thought for tomorrow," by giving all your attention to the present moment.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 118 | posizione 1803-1807 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:43:39

Your creative mechanism cannot function or work to- morrow. It can only function in the present—today. Make long range plans for tomorrow. But don't try to live in tomorrow, or in the past. Creative living means responding and reacting to environment spontaneously. Your creative mechanism can respond appropriately and success- fully to present environment—only if you have your full attention upon present environment—and give it informa- tion concerning what is happening now.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 119 | posizione 1811-1816 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:44:18

Live in Daytight Compartments Dr. William Osier said that this simple habit, which could be formed like any other habit, was the sole secret of his happiness and success in life. Live life in "daytight compartments," he advised his students. Look neither forward nor backward beyond a 24-hour cycle. Live today as best you can. By living today well you do the most within your power to make tomorrow better. If you have not read his excellent little essay,
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 119 | posizione 1823-1825 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:45:02

Alcoholics Anonymous uses the same principle when they say, "Don't try to stop drinking forever—merely say, 'I will not drink today.'"
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 119 | posizione 1825-1828 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:45:21

Stop— Look— and Listen! Practice becoming more consciously aware of your pres- ent environment. What sights, sounds, odors are present in your environment right now that you are not conscious of? Consciously practice looking and listening. Become alert to the feel of objects.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 121 | posizione 1854-1855 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:47:12

3. Try to do only one thing at a time.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 122 | posizione 1864-1865 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:48:01

The truth is: We can only "do" one thing at a time. Realizing this, fully convincing our- selves of this simple and obvious truth, enables us to men-
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 122 | posizione 1865-1867 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:48:06

tally stop trying to "do" the things that lie "next," and to concentrate all our awareness, all our responsiveness, on this one thing we are doing now. When we work with this attitude, we are relaxed, we are free from the feelings of
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 122 | posizione 1868-1868 | Aggiunto in data mercoledì 7 settembre 2016 07:48:11

hurry and anxiety, and we are able to concentrate and think at our best.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 122 | posizione 1869-1875 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:42:50

Dr. James Gordon Gilkey preached a sermon in 1944 called "Gaining Emotional Poise," which was reprinted in Reader's Digest and became a classic almost overnight. He had found, through many years of counselling, that one of the main causes of breakdown, worry, and all sorts of other personal problems, was this bad mental habit of feeling that you should be doing many things now. Looking at the hourglass on his desk, he had an in- spiration. Just as only one grain of sand could pass through the hourglass, so could we only do one thing at a time. It is not the job, but the way we insist upon
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 123 | posizione 1875-1875 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:42:56

think- ing of the job that causes the trouble.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 123 | posizione 1883-1884 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:43:57

This mental picture will bring emotional poise, just as the false mental picture will bring emotional unrest.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 124 | posizione 1891-1891 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:44:26

Sleep on it.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)

If you have been wrestling with a problem all day without making any apparent progress, try dismissing it from your mind, and put off making a decision until you've had a chance to "sleep on it."

Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 126 | posizione 1929-1929 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:44:45

Relax while you work. .
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 126 | posizione 1929-1935 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:45:15

Practice Exercise: In Chapter Four you learned how to induce physical and mental relaxation while resting. Continue with the daily practice in relaxation and you will become more and more proficient. In the meantime, you can induce something of "that relaxed feeling," and the relaxed attitude, while going about your daily activities, if you will form the habit of mentally remembering the nice relaxed feeling that you induced. Stop occasionally during the day, it need only take a moment, and remem- ber in detail the sensations of relaxation. Remember how your, arms felt, your legs, back, neck, face.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 127 | posizione 1935-1938 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 07:46:04

Sometimes forming a mental picture of yourself lying in bed, or sit- ting relaxed and limp in an easy chair helps to recall the relaxed sensations. Mentally repeating to yourself several times, "I feel more and more relaxed," also helps. Practice this remembering faithfully several times each day.
==========

The Attitude That Makes for Happiness

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 135 | posizione 2067-2068 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:11:24

Happiness is a symptom of normal, natural functioning and when man is functioning as a goal-striver, he tends to feel fairly happy, regardless of circumstances.

Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 135 | posizione 2069-2071 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:11:42

Thomas A. Edison lost a laboratory worth millions in a fire, with no insurance. "What in the world will you do?" someone asked. "We will start rebuilding tomorrow morning," said Edison. He maintained an aggressive attitude, he was still goal-oriented despite his misfortune.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 136 | posizione 2073-2074 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:12:04

Psychologist H. L. Hollingworth has said that happi- ness requires problems, plus a mental attitude that is ready to meet distress with action toward a solution.

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 136 | posizione 2075-2078 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:12:32

"It can so often be converted into a bracing and tonic good by a simple change of the sufferer's inner attitude from one of fear to one of fight; its sting can so often depart and turn into a relish when, after vainly seeking to shun it, we agree to face about and bear it cheerfully;
==========

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 137 | posizione 2097-2098 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:14:41

Practice Exercise: Form the habit of reacting aggressively and positively toward threats and problems. Form the
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 137 | posizione 2098-2104 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:14:50

habit of keeping goal-oriented all the time, regardless of what happens. Do this by practicing a positive aggressive attitude, both in actual everyday situations which come up, and also in your imagination. See yourself in your imagination taking positive, intelligent action toward solv- ing a problem or reaching a goal. See yourself reacting to threats, not by running away or evading them, but by meeting them, dealing with them, grappling with them in an aggressive and intelligent manner. "Most people are brave only in the dangers to which they accustom them-

How an Inventor Used "Happy-Thoughts"
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 143 | posizione 2183-2183 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:20:13

Professor Elmer Gates of the Smithsonian Institution
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 143 | posizione 2183-2189 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:20:26

was one of the most successful inventors this country has ever known, and a recognized genius. He made a daily practice of "calling up pleasant ideas and memories" and believed that this helped him in his work. If a person wants to improve himself, he said, "Let him summon those finer feelings of benevolence and usefulness, which are called up only now and then. Let him make this a regular exercise like swinging dumbbells. Let him gradu- ally increase the time devoted to these psychical gymnas- tics, and at the end of a month he will find the change in himself surprising.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 143 | posizione 2191-2191 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:20:35

How to Learn the Happiness Habit
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 144 | posizione 2201-2204 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:21:31

Habits, on the other hand, are merely reactions and responses which we have learned to perform automatically without having to "think" or "decide." They are performed by our Creative Mechanism. Fully 95 per cent of our behavior, feeling, and response is habitual.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 145 | posizione 2209-2211 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:21:59

What we need to understand is that these habits, unlike addictions, can be modified, changed, or reversed, simply by taking the trouble to make a conscious decision—and then by practicing or "acting out" the new response or behavior.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 145 | posizione 2214-2214 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:22:08

PRACTICE EXERCISE
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 145 | posizione 2214-2220 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:22:20

Habitually, you put on either your right shoe first or your left shoe. Habitually, you tie your shoes by either passing the right-hand lace around behind the left-hand lace, "or vice versa. Tomorrow morning determine which shoe you put on first and how you tie your shoes. Now, consciously decide that for the next 21 days you are going to form a new habit by putting on the other shoe first and tying your laces in a different way. Now, each morning as you decide to put on your shoes in a certain manner, let this simple act serve as a reminder to change other habit-
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 145 | posizione 2220-2226 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:22:29

ual ways of thinking, acting and feeling throughout that one day. Say to yourself as you tie your shoes, "I am beginning the day in a new and better way." Then, con- sciously decide that throughout the day: 1. I will be as cheerful as possible. 2. I will try to feel and act a little more friendly toward other people. 3. I am going to be a little less critical and a little more tolerant of other people, their faults, failings and mistakes. I will place the best possible interpretation upon their actions. 4. Insofar as possible, I am going to act as if success were inevitable, and I already am the sort of personality
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 146 | posizione 2226-2232 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:22:37

want to be. I will practice "acting like" and "feeling like" this new personality. 5. I will not let my own opinion color facts in a pessimis- tic or negative way. 6. I will practice smiling at least three times during the day. 7. Regardless of what happens, I will react as calmly and as intelligently as possible. 8. I will ignore completely and close my mind to all those pessimistic and negative "facts" which I can do nothing to change. Simple? Yes. But each of the above habitual ways of acting, feeling, thinking does have beneficial and con-
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 146 | posizione 2232-2234 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:22:43

structive influence on your self-image. Act them out for 21 days. "Experience" them, and see if worry, guilt, hostility have not been diminished and if confidence has not been increased.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 146 | posizione 2236-2237 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:22:49

(1) SENSE OF DIRECTION: The advertising executive "straightened himself out" and regained his confidence within a short time, once he saw clearly that for several years he had been motivated by strong personal goals which he wanted to attain, including securing his present position.

Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)

These goals, which were important to him, kept him on the track.

However, once he got the promotion, he ceased to

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 149 | posizione 2275-2276 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:28:17

think in terms of what he wanted, but in terms of what others expected of him, or whether he was living up to other people's goals and standards.

Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 150 | posizione 2287-2287 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:29:43

We are engineered as goal-seeking mechanisms.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 150 | posizione 2288-2289 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:30:02

When we have no personal goal which we are interested in and which "means something" to us, we are apt to "go around in circles," feel "lost" and find life itself "aimless," and "purposeless."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 150 | posizione 2292-2294 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:30:24

Prescription: Get yourself a goal worth working for. Better still, get yourself a project. Decide what you want out of a situation. Always have something ahead of you to "look forward to"—to work for and hope for.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 150 | posizione 2294-2295 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:30:40

Develop what one of the automobile manufacturers calls "the forward look." Develop a "nostalgia for the future" instead of for the past.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 150 | posizione 2294-2300 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 08:30:50

Develop what one of the automobile manufacturers calls "the forward look." Develop a "nostalgia for the future" instead of for the past. The "forward look" and a "nostalgia for the future" can keep you youthful. Even your body doesn't function well when you stop being a goal-striver and "have nothing to look forward to." This is the reason that very often when a man retires, he dies shortly thereafter. When you're not goal-striving, not looking forward, you're not really "living." In addition to your purely personal goals, have at least one impersonal goal—or "cause"--which you can identify yourself with. Get interested in some project to help your fellow man—not out of a sense of duty, but because you want to.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 151 | posizione 2301-2301 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:03:43

(2) UNDERSTANDING:
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 151 | posizione 2301-2301 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:03:47

Understanding depends upon good communication.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 151 | posizione 2301-2302 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:03:55

Communication is vital to any guidance system or com-
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 151 | posizione 2302-2306 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:04:07

puter. You cannot react appropriately if the information you act upon is faulty or misunderstood. Many doctors believe that "confusion" is the basic element in neurosis. To deal effectively with a problem, you must have some understanding of its true nature. Most of our failures in human relations are due to "misunderstandings."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 151 | posizione 2307-2308 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:04:25

We should remember what we said in an earlier chapter—no one reacts to "things
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 151 | posizione 2308-2314 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:04:47

they are," but to his own mental images. Most of the time the other person's reaction or position is not taken in order to make us suffer, nor to be hardheaded, nor mali- cious, but because he "understands" and interprets the situation differently from us. He is merely responding appropriately to what— to him—seems to be the truth about the situation. To give the other person credit for be- ing sincere, if mistaken, rather than willful and malicious, can do much to smooth out human relations and bring about better understanding between people. Ask your- self, "How does this appear—to him?" "How does he interpret this situation?" "How does he feel about it?" Try to understand why he might "act the way he does."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 152 | posizione 2324-2325 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:09:32

Be Willing to See the Truth
==========

Bertrand Russell said

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 152 | posizione 2328-2330 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:09:49

one reason Hitler lost World War II was that he did not fully understand the situation. Bearers of bad news were punished.

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 152 | posizione 2330-2331 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:10:25

Soon no 6ne dared tell him the truth. Not know- ing the truth, he could not act appropriately. Many of us are individually guilty of the same error.
==========

- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 153 | posizione 2335-2336 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:11:05

The Success-type personality not only does not cheat and lie to other people, he learns to be honest with himself.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 153 | posizione 2338-2340 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:11:26

Prescription: Look for and seek out true information concerning yourself, your problems, other people, or the situation, whether it is good news or bad news. Adopt the motto—"It doesn't matter who's right, but what's right."
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 153 | posizione 2342-2344 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:12:22

Admit your mistakes and errors but don't cry over them. Cor- rect them and go forward. In dealing with other people try to see the situation from their point of view as well as your own.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 153 | posizione 2344-2344 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:12:26

(3) COURAGE:
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 153 | posizione 2345-2346 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:12:38

Having a goal and understanding the situation are not enough. You must have the courage to act, for only by actions can goals, desires and beliefs be translated into realities.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 155 | posizione 2362-2366 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:16:27

Pick out the course which gives the most promise—and go ahead. If we wait until we are i absolutely certain and sure before we act we will never do anything. Any time you act you can be wrong. Any de- cision you make can turn out to be the wrong one. But we must not let this deter us from going after the goal we want. You must daily have the courage to risk making mistakes, risk failure, risk being humiliated.
==========
Psycho-Cybernetics (Sconosciuto)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 155 | posizione 2371-2374 | Aggiunto in data giovedì 8 settembre 2016 17:18:25

When we have faith and act with courage—that is exactly what we're doing-—gambling on, taking a chance on, our own creative God-given talents. It is also my theory that people who frustrate this natural instinct, by refusing to

Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 79 | posizione 1207-1211 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 16:13:55

Some programmers become inadvertently trapped by their motivations. In More Secrets of Consulting, Dorset House, Jerry Weinberg describes this phenomenon as the Golden Lock: “I’d like to learn something new, but what I already know pays too well.” The risk of the Golden Lock highlights the importance of aligning your motivations with The Long Road, which requires the ambition to achieve mastery. A desire for mastery should motivate you to be wary of Golden Locks as they inevitably present themselves.
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 79 | posizione 1211-1213 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 16:14:08

As you progress as a craftsman, you will be faced with tough decisions that will determine whether you have the freedom to stay on The Long Road or whether you will find yourself trapped in a Golden Lock.
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 83 | posizione 1270-1272 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 16:49:52

To grow your passion, set clear boundaries that define the sort of environment you are willing to work in. This might mean you leave work while the rest of the team stays late, that you walk out of a meeting that has become abusive, that you steer a cynical conversation
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 83 | posizione 1272-1274 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 16:50:11

toward constructive topics, or that you refuse to distribute code that doesn’t meet your minimum standards. The result could be that you get passed over for pay raises, promotions, kudos, or popularity. But these boundaries are necessary if you are going to break free of hostile conditions and keep your passion strong.
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 85 | posizione 1295-1300 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 16:52:11

Identify a logical but ambitious next step for your career. Understand that it’s not up to your employer, your career counselor, or your professors to give you a hand up. Arriving at your next step and charting the course to ultimately arrive at your ideal destination is your responsibility. With your next career step identified, visualize the smaller, interim steps you need to take to move forward. It is vitally important that you take the first step even if it doesn’t seem that significant. That first step will generate the momentum that will help carry you toward your goals. It’s the willingness to take that first terrifying step (and all the other steps later on), even in the absence of a perfect plan, that turns your map from a daydream into reality.
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1674-1677 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:12:44

Action List all the communities you could potentially join based on the tools you use, the languages you know, the people you have worked with, the blogs you read, and the ideas you are intrigued by. Identify which of those groups gather in the real world in your city. One by one, attend all these gatherings, and decide which groups seem most interesting.
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1677-1679 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:13:45

What if none of the groups regularly meet near you? In that case, you’ve just been given a golden opportunity to create one of these gatherings. Start a regular meetup of software craftsmen in your region. It’s a lot less work than you would think. Just don’t make the mistake of restricting the membership or the topics too early. Instead, advertise anywhere and everywhere
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 110 | posizione 1679-1684 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:13:51

that software developers in your region might see it. As your group grows, feel free to explore a wide and bizarre range of topics until you have a core group of irregulars. Over time, that self-selected group of irregulars will define the nature of your group. You won’t always have the same people attending every fortnight—that’s what makes them irregulars. Groups like the Extreme Tuesday Club have a few hundred “members”; on any given Tuesday there will only be a dozen or so people in attendance. If your group becomes large enough and energetic enough, it will sustain itself even when you are not there. That’s when you know you have a community.
==========

==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 122 | posizione 1857-1865 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:27:40

Sign up for Google Reader (or another blog aggregator) and begin subscribing to software development blogs. With modern machine translation technologies, you don’t even have to restrict yourself to those who write in English. You can follow Tim O’Reilly’s advice and track the blogs of what he calls “alpha geeks” across a variety of technology domains.[26] These people aren’t necessarily the best programmers, but collectively they tend to sense new trends years before the rest of us. Consider using your own blog to reflect on the themes you pick up from these bloggers. Start following some software luminaries on Twitter and pay attention to what they’re working on. Subscribe to a moderately high-traffic online mailing list and try to answer people’s questions by reproducing their issues.
==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 122 | posizione 1866-1873 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:27:49

Join a newly formed local user group that is excited about a new technology. Don’t just attend silently—introduce yourself to the organizer and offer to help. Persuade your employer to send you to a technical conference. Even if they won’t pay for you to attend, you can still read the slides on the website and download audio/video of the speeches. After you read a book, contact the author with a note of appreciation and a question. Authors, speakers, and luminaries may seem intimidating or busy, but they often enjoy corresponding with readers. Don’t forget that there are hundreds of online academic courses, podcasts, and videos (such as Google’s extensive series of Tech Talks) available for free through iTunes and
==========

Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 126 | posizione 1930-1936 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:31:07

Laurent Bossavit and a group of software developers in Paris took the martial arts metaphor a step further and created a coder’s dojo, a place where people could meet regularly to publicly perform code katas. “Uncle” Bob Martin, inspired by the Paris dojo, also posts katas to his blog, espousing the merits of practicing the craft: Beginners learn by doing, not through lecture. They practice, and practice, and practice.... By repeating and repeating these same exercises, we sharpen our skills, we train our bodies and our minds to respond to the disciplines of TDD and simple design. We wire, and rewire, and rewire, and rewire our neurons to react in the right way.[
==========

==========
Apprenticeship Patterns (Dave Hoover)
- La tua evidenziazione a pagina 127 | posizione 1941-1943 | Aggiunto in data sabato 17 settembre 2016 17:32:01

Short feedback loops need to be incorporated into your practice sessions. While practice is good in theory, if you’re not getting periodic feedback you’re probably developing bad habits. This is the beauty of the coder’s dojo: public performance within the context of a tight-knit community of craftsmen.
==========
